title: a load of hooey
description:
A Load of Hooey (Odenkirk Memorial Library)
by Bob Odenkirk

Bob Odenkirk is a legend in the comedy-writing world, winning Emmys and acclaim for his work on Saturday Night Live, Mr. Show with Bob and David, and many other seminal TV shows. This book, his first, is a spleen-bruisingly funny omnibus that ranges from absurdist monologues (Ã¢â‚¬Å“Martin Luther King, JrÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Worst Speech EverÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½) to intentionally bad theater (Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hitler Dinner Party: A PlayÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½); from avant-garde fiction (Ã¢â‚¬Å“Obituary for the Creator of MadlibsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½) to free-verse poetry that's funnier and more powerful than the work of Calvin Trillin, Jewel, and Robert Louis Stevenson combined.
